Overseas U.S. Adult Passport Renewal

You may renew your adult passport by mail using application form DS-82, provided you meet all four of the following requirements:

  • You have a passport that is not damaged; and
  • It was issued within the past 15 years; and
  • You were at least age 16 when it was issued; and
  • You still have the same name in your most recent passport (or you can legally document your name change).

If you meet the above requirements, no appointment is necessary.  To renew your passport please submit the documents listed below in a sealed envelope to the Embassy’s Service entrance (during business hours) or through DHL.

  • The application for an adult passport renewal (DS-82).  Please ensure your application is signed.
  • Two (2) color photos (2”x2”) (front view, no glasses, full face, and plain white or off-white background)
  • Your most recent U.S. Passport.
  • Receipt for application fee of $ 130.00 USD (U.S. dollars or Ghana cedis equivalent) paid online at Pay.gov.

Please address all DHL or drop box mail to:

Embassy of the United States of America

American Citizen Services Unit

No. 24, Fourth Circular Road

Accra, Ghana

 

Passport Renewal for Children under 16

 

Children must appear in person accompanied by parents.  The day of your appointment, bring the following documents with you to the consular section:

  • Birth certificate (showing parents’ names)
  • Minor Passport renewal Application form (DS-11) completed but not signed until you are requested to do so by a Consular Officer.
  • Your child’s most recent U.S. passport
  • Application fee $ 135.00 USD (U.S. dollars or Ghana cedis equivalent) or Receipt for application fee paid online at Pay.gov.
  • Two (2) color photos (2”x 2”) (front view, full face and plain white or off-white background)
  • Photo identification of both parents.  Please note: if any parent listed on the birth certificate is unable to appear at the child’s passport interview, that parent must provide an original notarized DS-3053 consent form and a copy of the parent’s valid ID (passport or driver’s license).
  • Proof of the child’s U.S. citizenship (if child acquired U. S. citizenship at or after birth), such as a Consular Report of Birth Abroad (FS-240), a Naturalization Certificate, or a Certificate of Citizenship, along with photo identification.  For children who may have changed substantially in physical appearance, we suggest you bring photos showing the child in the years since the issuance of the previous passport.
